question.title: Spring EntityManager persist vs merge for manual cascading one to many relationship
question.body:
I have Post and Comment entities with one to many relationship.

    @Entity
public class Post{
    @Id
    private Integer id;

    @OneToMany(mappedBy  ="post")
    private Set<Comment> comments;
}

In the Post class i have not defined Cascade because i will do the cascading "manually" in the service class.

here is my dao class

public class PostDao{

    @PersistenceContext
    protected EntityManager entityManager;
    public Post save(Post post){
        if(post.getId() == null){
            entityManager.persist(post);
            return post;
        }else {
            return entityManager.merge(post);
        }
    }

Here is my service class and where am facing difficulty

public class PostService{
private PostDao postDao;
 public Post savePost(Post post){ 
    Post managedPost = postDao.save(post);
    }
}

my questions

  1. what does the persist method return here ? the same object with id field added or completely new object ?

  2. since am not using cascading will the merge method fetch the comments from the db ? will there be any conflict if there is difference between the set of comments from the managed and detached objects.

  3. basically what i want is persist / merge the Post first then get the comments and persist/merge them too. something like this

    public Post savePost(Post post){ Post managedPost = postDao.save(post); //get the comment i don't know which to use post or managedPost Set comments = post/managedPost.getComments(); //loop each comment and persist it }

tnks

question_comments.body: This kind of reads like you're stringing together low-quality tutorials rather than reading the JPA specification documentation. JPA is the type of technology where you must read the documentation. Especially question #1 is extremely fundamental.
